comments.body: Maybe add a line or two about setting `ETCD_VERSION` env? The current version is fixed to `2.2.1`. Would be worth to mention one can check `https://github.com/coreos/etcd/releases` and set the env to newer version, e.g. `2.3.5`.
I'll take a PR in a follow-up.  Mostly wanted to get the filtering in for tests now since it is a topic of considerable confusion

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +200,204 @@
# Option a) install inside kubernetes root
hack/install-etcd.sh  # Installs in ./third_party/etcd
echo export PATH="$PATH:$(pwd)/third_party/etcd" >> ~/.profile  # Add to PATH

comments.body: does `make test` build autogenerated files (it needs to, or test will not be testing the right thing)? if so, the last sentence is probably not true.
make test does the right thing.  Any invocation through `make` should DTRT.

`make test` is the entrypoint for running the unit tests that ensures that
`GOPATH` is set up correctly.  If you have `GOPATH` set up correctly, you can
also just use `go test` directly.

comments.body: Not automatically.  It is exactly the same as hack/build-go.sh.  ./foo/... does not seem to work (it should, I think, but it never did)
